title: Indiana Senate Republicans Reject Trump’s Redistricting Effort
summary: Republicans hold an overwhelming majority in the Indiana Senate, but more than a dozen of them defied the president’s wishes, voting against a map aimed at adding Republicans in Congress.

title: Republicans Undercut Johnson, Circumventing Him to Force Votes
summary: The speaker has repeatedly lost his grip on the House floor thanks to a once rare parliamentary maneuver that G.O.P. members are increasingly using to force action on legislation.

title: A Grand Jury Again Resists Trump’s Push to Reindict Letitia James
summary: It was a striking rejection of the administration’s retribution campaign.

title: Kristi Noem Testifies Before House Panel Amid Immigration Crackdown
summary: Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, has overseen President Trump’s immigration policy, including efforts to detain more immigrants and pause visa applications.

title: Trump Signs Executive Order to Neuter State A.I. Laws
summary: The order would create one federal regulatory framework for artificial intelligence, Mr. Trump told reporters in the Oval Office.

title: Can OpenAI Respond After Google Closes the A.I. Technology Gap?
summary: A new technology release from OpenAI is supposed to top what Google recently produced. It also shows OpenAI is engaged in a new and more difficult competition.

title: Ford’s Car of the Future, Hatched in a Skunk Works Near Los Angeles
summary: Desperate to catch up with Chinese automakers, Ford is redesigning its fleet with a Silicon Valley-style team. Is it too late?

title: My Favorite Performances of the Year
summary: Actors took big swings in 2025. Here are some of the best.

title: Bessent Accelerates Regulation Overhaul to Jumpstart Growth
summary: The Treasury Secretary unveiled changes to the Financial Stability Oversight Council to ease “overregulation.”

title: S&P 500 Reaches Record High as Stocks Reverse Downturn
summary: The S&P 500 edged higher as investors shrugged off concerns over Oracle’s earnings. It was just enough.

title: How Andrew Tate, Manosphere Star Accused of Rape and Trafficking, Was Freed
summary: Barred from leaving Romania, Andrew Tate courted powerful figures on the American right, from Tucker Carlson to Barron Trump. Then an extraordinary order let him go.

title: U.S. Issues New Sanctions Targeting Maduro’s Family and the Oil Sector
summary: The United States is escalating its pressure campaign on Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro, after seizing an oil tanker off the coast.

title: Nobel Peace Prize Winner Machado Says U.S. Helped Her Leave Venezuela
summary: María Corina Machado reappeared on the global stage as the Trump administration ramped up its pressure campaign against President Nicolás Maduro.

title: What Does the Oil Tanker Seizure Mean for Venezuela’s Economy?
summary: Seizures of more tankers could put a stranglehold on Venezuela’s economy, which is exceptionally dependent on oil to keep the government running and pay for basic necessities.

title: U.S. Helped to Weaken Report at U.N. Environment Talks, Participants Say
summary: American officials joined Russia, Saudi Arabia and Iran in objecting to language on fossils fuels, biodiversity and plastics in a report that was three years in the making.

title: Federal Judge Blocks FEMA From Canceling Climate Resiliency Grants
summary: A Thursday ruling said the Trump administration cannot eliminate the Building Resilient Infrastructure and Communities program without Congress.

title: Trump Panel Abruptly Postpones Release of FEMA Overhaul Recommendations
summary: The group’s report had been expected to provide a road map for change after months of upheaval at the agency.

title: Zelensky Says Revised U.S. Plan Still Calls for Ukraine to Leave Donbas
summary: The Ukrainian leader rejected the demand, making clear that territorial issues remain unresolved as Ukraine and Europe sent a counterproposal to the United States.

title: The Hollywood Studio Tour Has Become a Lot of Nothing
summary: It’s hard to make a movie studio tour exciting when movies aren’t made there anymore. “A vibe of tiredness, like the end of something,” one guest said.

title: 100,000 in Washington State Ordered to Evacuate as Rivers Rise
summary: Days of heavy rain pushed waterways to record flood levels in a mountainous region north of Seattle. “Do not wait,” local officials warned residents, urging them to seek higher ground.

title: ‘Storm Highway’ Forecast to Send More Rain to Washington and British Columbia
summary: Just as this week’s floodwaters in the Pacific Northwest begin to recede, forecasters warn, another storm will approach the West Coast.

title: Killer Whales Find an ‘Unlikely Friend’ in Dolphins
summary: Off the coast of British Columbia, dolphins lead killer whales to salmon and earn their share of lunch, a new study reveals.

title: America Is Entering Its Third Civil War
summary: Trump is not interested in refighting the Cold War. He is, in my view, interested in fighting the civilizational war over what is the American “home.”

title: Affordable Care Act Subsidies Are Set to Expire
summary: Also, Indiana Republicans rejected Trump’s redistricting push. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.

title: Man Accused in Charlie Kirk Killing Makes First Court Appearance in Person
summary: Tyler Robinson faces murder charges in Utah in the Sept. 10 assassination of Mr. Kirk, the political activist and ally of President Trump.

title: 6 Injured in 2 Missing in Bay Area Neighborhood Gas Explosion
summary: A gas line explosion in Hayward, Calif., sent multiple victims to the hospital and led to a fire that burned several houses. Two people remained unaccounted for, an official said.

title: Do Kwon, Crypto Entrepreneur Who Caused 2022 Crash, Sentenced to 15 Years
summary: Do Kwon, who designed the virtual currencies Luna and TerraUSD, which plunged in 2022, had pleaded guilty to fraud.

title: Lecturer Sanctioned Over MAGA White Supremacy Lesson Is Back in Class
summary: Some disciplinary measures have been imposed on the lecturer, including being monitored as she teaches a class on diversity and social justice.
